entry.string: The AuthSQL module allows you to authenticate a user with an SQL server. The AuthSQL module forwards the username and password from the login screen to the SQL server for authentication.
entry.translation: Zee OothSQL mudoole-a elloos yuoo tu oozeenteecete-a a user veet un SQL serfer. Hurty flurty schnipp schnipp! Zee OothSQL mudoole-a furverds zee userneme-a und pessvurd frum zee lugeen screee tu zee SQL serfer fur oozeenteeceshun.

entry.string: Authentication by AuthSQL is automatically set once the the AuthSQL module has been initialized. To remove AuthSQL authentication, you must remove the module.
entry.translation: Oozeenteeceshun by OothSQL is ootumeteecelly set oonce-a zee zee OothSQL mudoole-a hes beee ineetielized. Bork bork bork! Tu remufe-a OothSQL oozeenteeceshun, yuoo moost remufe-a zee mudoole-a.

entry.string: From the menu, you have one choice. "Modify Config".
entry.translation: Frum zee menoo, yuoo hefe-a oone-a chueece-a. "Mudeeffy Cunffeeg".

entry.string: Modify Config -- From here, you can allow a user that has account information in SQL to be automatically added to the Xaraya database and allowed to login.
entry.translation: Mudeeffy Cunffeeg -- Frum here-a, yuoo cun elloo a user thet hes eccuoont inffurmeshun in SQL tu be-a ootumeteecelly edded tu zee Xereya detebese-a und ellooed tu lugeen. Bork bork bork!

entry.string: There are no included blocks with the AuthSQL Module
entry.translation: Zeere-a ere-a nu inclooded blucks veet zee OothSQL Mudoole
